H0.text: Circulatory is the system in which peristalsis helps move nutrients through parts of the body by using wavelike contractions.

H1.text: Digestive is the system in which peristalsis, which helps move nutrients through parts of the body by using wavelike contractions, is used.

H2.text: Endocrine is the system in which peristalsis helps move nutrients through parts of the body by using wavelike contractions.

H3.text: The nervous system is the system in which peristalsis, which helps move nutrients through parts of the body by using wavelike contractions, is used.

A4.text: The human lymphatic system has no central pump. Instead, lymph circulates through peristalsis in the lymph capillaries as well as valves in the capillaries, compression during contraction of adjacent skeletal muscle, and arterial pulsation.

A5.text: The process of peristalsis is controlled by the medulla oblongata.
